title: Odisha Woman Raped Twice In 1 Day, Dies After Being Thrown Off Building: Cops
content: A 23-year-old woman was raped twice in a day in separate places by her boyfriend and a stranger offering help and then thrown off a four-storey building, leading to her death, in Odisha's Jagatsinghpur district, police said on Friday.

content: The defence ministry on Friday said three flight-trials of a very short-range air defence missile system were conducted successfully from Chandipur off the coast of Odisha.

content: Iran is reportedly nearing a deal with China to purchase anti-ship cruise missiles, as the US threatens strikes on the Islamic Republic and presses its biggest military build-up in the Middle East in decades.

title: DMK Youth Wing Member Arrested For Alleged Sexual Assault, Murder Of Toddler
content: A functionary of the youth wing of the ruling Dravida Munnetra Kazhagam (DMK) has been arrested for the alleged sexual assault and murder of a two-and-a-half-year-old girl in Tamil Nadu's Krishnagiri district, police said.

title: On Camera, Thar Drags Burning Motorcycle For 7 km In Noida Highway Escape
content: A driver in Uttar Pradesh's Greater Noida has been detained after allegedly attempting to flee a petrol station without payment, leading to a dramatic chase that ended with a motorcycle being dragged for several kilometres along a major highway.

title: Zohran Mamdani Meets Trump, Seeks $21 Billion For Affordable Housing Push
content: New York Mayor Zohran Mamdani met President Donald Trump on Thursday to urge him to release $21 billion in federal grants to build 12,000 affordable housing units and infrastructure.

title: Woman Mutilates Lover's Private Parts After Learning He Hid His Marriage
content: A 22-year-old quack doctor's private part was mutilated by a woman in north Delhi's Wazirabad area after she came to know about his marriage, police said on Friday.

title: BJP To Launch Large-Scale 'Parivartan Yatra' In Poll-Bound Bengal From Sunday
content: The Parivartan Yatra will be held simultaneously across all nine organisational divisions of West Bengal, covering nearly 5,000 km.

title: Trump's "Don't Want To, But Have To" Warning On Iran Military Action
content: US President Donald Trump said he was not happy with Iran but more talks were expected on Friday on Tehran's nuclear program.

title: Iran Warns US To Scale Back 'Excessive Demands' Amid Last Ditch Negotiations
content: Iran said Friday that in order to reach a deal, the United States will have to drop its "excessive demands", tempering the optimism expressed after talks seen as a last-ditch bid to avert war.

title: Amit Shah Orders Crackdown On Illegal Activities Along Indo-Nepal Border
content: Union Home Minister Amit Shah chaired a high-level meeting with District Magistrates (DMs) and Superintendents of Police (SPs) from seven districts of the Seemanchal region, focusing on tightening security along the Indo-Nepal border.

title: Bedrooms For Sale Highlight Depths Of Europe's Housing Crisis
content: A Spanish startup is selling bedrooms in flats shared with strangers, a British developer offers mortgages for friends willing to buy together, while stakes in rental properties help some tenants cover their housing costs.

title: 'Not A Good Father During War': Zelensky On Personal Cost Of Russia's Invasion
content: Ukraine's President Volodymyr Zelensky has said that because of the war with Russia, he did not have much time for his children and labelled himself as "not the best father". He said that his duty was his choice during the war.

title: "I Saw Nothing, Did Nothing Wrong": Bill Clinton Testifies On Epstein Files
content: "I saw nothing, and I did nothing wrong," the former Democratic president said in an opening statement he shared on social media at the outside of the deposition.

title: MS Dhoni Gets Housing Board Notice Over Commercial Use' Of Ranchi Home
content: Former Indian cricket team captain Mahendra Singh Dhoni has been served a notice by the Jharkhand State Housing Board over alleged commercial use of his residential plot in Ranchi.

title: How Friendly Chat On Train Led To SIM-Porting Nightmare For Delhi Woman
content: A friendly conversation on a train journey turned into a nightmare for a Delhi woman after a fellow passenger allegedly hijacked her SIM card to drain her credit cards.

title: 'Parliament Has Absolute Prerogative To Enact Laws': Supreme Court On Sedition Pleas
content: An advocate appearing for the petitioners claimed Section 152 reintroduces Section 124A (sedition) of the erstwhile Indian Penal Code.

title: Congress Legal Notice Triggers Video Takedowns In AI Summit Row, BJP Holds Ground
content: The political battle over alleged paid content targeting the AI Summit intensified with the Indian National Congress claiming several influencers deleted posts after a legal warning, even as the Bharatiya Janata Party stood by its charges.

title: Arvind Kejriwal: A Political Comeback Congress Didn't See Coming
content: Arvind Kejriwal, the country's first sitting chief minister to be arrested while in office, struggled to contain his emotions after being cleared of all charges in the excise policy case that had defined his political life for nearly two years.

title: England beat NZ: What Pakistan must do now to qualify for T20 WC semifinals
content: England now have three wins from three matches in the Super Eights. New Zealand sit second in Group 2 with three points, while Pakistan are third with one point. Pakistan must register a big win against already-eliminated Sri Lanka on Saturday to move ahead of New Zealand and qualify for the semifinals.

title: ‚ÄòDon‚Äôt delay process with vague reasons‚Äô: SC raps WB govt for rushing to court daily against SIR
content: The Supreme Court reprimanded the West Bengal government for repeatedly filing vague complaints to delay the Special Intensive Revision of electoral rolls. The court clarified that while the High Court Chief Justice would decide deployment modalities, judicial officers alone would assess voter claims and document validity, urging the state to cooperate for expeditious completion.

title: Why employees of Europe‚Äôs biggest software giant are ‚Äòangry‚Äô with company‚Äôs bonus system
content: SAP faces internal turmoil over a new bonus system favouring underperforming managers over diligent staff. This has sparked team conflicts and questions about fairness amid restructuring.  Employee trust in leadership is reportedly declining, adding pressure as the company navigates AI's impact on enterprise software.

title: Court relief for Kejriwal: How BJP seized upon excise row to turn tables on AAP
content: The BJP identified the excise controversy as a significant vulnerability for the AAP, portraying it as a departure from their anti-corruption roots. This issue, coupled with the "Sheesh Mahal" controversy and governance challenges, eroded AAP's credibility and contributed to their political downfall in Delhi.

title: ‚ÄòPeople I really respect‚Äô: Trump lauds Shehbaz Sharif, Asim Munir amid Pak-Afghan conflict
content: Former President Donald Trump's past praise for Pakistan's leadership signals a potential diplomatic tilt amid escalating tensions with Afghanistan.  Recent cross-border clashes, including air and artillery strikes, have marked an unprecedented deterioration in relations between the two neighboring countries.

title: Chloe Kim posts concerning note after Myles Garrett admission
content: The Cleveland Browns' star player, Myles Garrett, has turned heads with his high profile romance with three time Olympian Chloe Kim. After her recent silver medal win at the 2026 Winter Olympics, Chloe Kim became more and more public with her life and relationship. It seems this might have caused an issue in her life as she has now made a concerning post.

title: Tech startups in US to employees: Leave your shoes behind; reason is said to be China
content: A viral social media post highlights a growing trend in San Francisco's tech scene: a 'no shoes' policy at offices. Startups like Cursor, Replo, and Spur are encouraging employees to shed their footwear, aiming to create a more relaxed, home-like atmosphere.

title: 'Unwarranted': Why Delhi court rapped CBI for 'South Group' tag in liquor policy case
content: A Delhi court discharged former chief minister Arvind Kejriwal, manish sisodia and 21 others in the liquor policy case, criticizing the CBI for using the term 'South Group'. The judge stated the label lacked legal basis, was arbitrary, and could prejudice proceedings, urging the agency to use neutral, evidence-based language.

title: Amazon CEO does for Sam Altman what Nvidia CEO is having second thoughts on
content: Amazon is injecting $50 billion into AI leader OpenAI, solidifying a strategic partnership. This collaboration will see AWS offer a new 'Stateful Runtime Environment' for generative AI apps, powered by OpenAI models. OpenAI will also leverage AWS's custom Trainium chips, boosting performance and cost-efficiency for their advanced AI workloads.

title: Shoes outside! Silicon Valley startups adopt desi habit
content: A growing trend in San Francisco's tech scene sees employees leaving shoes outside office doors, a practice inspired by cultural norms. Startups like Cursor and Spur are adopting this policy, with leaders citing a desire to create a more comfortable, home-like atmosphere and practical benefits like cleanliness. This shift reflects the lingering influence of remote work habits on corporate culture.

title: 'We know where you live': Convicts to judge after murder case sentence
content: Two men, sentenced to life for a dowry-related murder in Bijnor, issued chilling threats to the judge and the victim's daughter in court.  The convicts vowed revenge, prompting immediate police action to secure the judge's residence and ensure his safety. The murder victim was killed over a dowry dispute involving his daughter.

title: NFL Rumors: Patriots set to pair Stefon Diggs and A.J. Brown with Drake Maye
content: The New England Patriots are reportedly exploring a trade for Philadelphia Eagles wide receiver A.J. Brown to pair him with Stefon Diggs and quarterback Drake Maye. This potential move aims to bolster a struggling offense and accelerate Maye's development, though significant hurdles remain with the Eagles' willingness to trade.

title: Cavaliers vs Pistons: Key injuries and status for Feb 27, 2026 game
content: Detroit Pistons host the Cleveland Cavaliers in a crucial Eastern Conference clash. The top-ranked Pistons face an injury-plagued Cavaliers squad missing key players like Donovan Mitchell. With Detroit boasting a healthier roster and home-court advantage, they aim to solidify their conference lead, while Cleveland battles to stay competitive despite significant absences.

title: Is Shai Gilgeous-Alexander on restriction vs Denver Nuggets?
content: Shai Gilgeous-Alexander returns for the Oklahoma City Thunder tonight against the Denver Nuggets after an abdominal strain, though his minutes will likely be monitored. Despite injuries to other key players, the Thunder lead the Western Conference. SGA remains in the MVP race, needing to play in six more games to qualify for postseason honors.

title: Rajpal Yadav makes his first public appearance amid Rs 9 crore cheque bounce case
content: Weeks after being caught in a Rs 9 crore cheque bounce case, Rajpal Yadav stepped out in Mumbai ‚Äî and turned a routine paparazzi spotting into a throwback moment. The actor, attending an event in the city, broke into a playful hop when photographers began chanting ‚ÄúPaani, paani,‚Äù a dialogue linked to his unforgettable Chhota Pandit character from Bhool Bhulaiyaa.

title: 'Don't want to, but sometimes you have to': Trump again warns Iran of possible military action
content: Despite a significant military build-up in the Middle East, US President Trump expressed his unhappiness with Iran but remains open to a deal, reiterating his core demand that Tehran must not possess nuclear weapons. While military action is a last resort, diplomatic efforts continue, with talks scheduled and US officials engaging with mediators.

title: From the Durand Line to today: Why Kabul and Pak can't make peace
content: Pakistan conducted air strikes in Afghanistan, escalating border tensions and leading to retaliatory actions by Taliban forces. This marks a serious confrontation, rooted in historical ties, the TTP's presence, and the disputed Durand Line. Both nations exchanged claims of casualties and territorial gains amidst declarations of 'open war'.

title: Rinku Singh to rejoin India squad for virtual knockout after father's demise
content: Rinku Singh will rejoin the India squad in Kolkata on Saturday. He will be available for the T20 World Cup Super 8 match against the West Indies. This match is a virtual knockout for a semifinal spot. India faces the West Indies on Sunday. The winner advances to join South Africa in the semifinals.

title: Alia Bhatt breaks silence on BAFTA, Gone Girl backlash
content: After days of social media chatter, Alia Bhatt has finally responded to the online backlash that followed her appearance at the 79th British Academy Film Awards (BAFTA). In the now-viral video, Alia appeared momentarily surprised before naming Gone Girl. Several social media users suggested she looked nervous or was attempting to channel a confident ‚Äúinternational star‚Äù persona.

title: US attack on Iran imminent? UK pulls staff, China issues travel warning as tensions rise
content: Amid escalating Iran tensions, Britain, the US, and China are evacuating non-essential personnel from the Middle East. The US is conducting its largest military build-up in decades, while diplomatic talks continue. Citizens are urged to leave Iran as fears of conflict intensify, despite ongoing negotiations aimed at de-escalation.

title: ‚ÄòBridgerton S04‚Äô: Benedict-Sophie‚Äôs Cinderella tale and beyond
content: Bridgerton Season 4 concludes with Benedict and Sophie's heartwarming Cinderella-esque romance and a surprise wedding.  The season explored their love against societal norms, with Benedict embracing his pansexuality.  Notably, Daphne and Simon remain absent, with showrunners opting against recasting.  A new Lady Whistledown emerges, reigniting the show's signature mystery.

title: Horoscope Today: Daily astrological predictions for February 28, 2026
content: Horoscope Today: Read daily horoscope predictions for February 28, 2026. Know all about the astrological events and influences that will be affecting each of the 12 zodiac signs. Our astrologer has analyzed the movements of the planets and the alignment of the stars to bring you the most accurate and up-to-date horoscope predictions for the day ahead. Get ready to discover what the stars have in store for you today.

title: What is an 'Alpine Divorce'? The chilling viral breakup trend that is shocking social media
content: A chilling new trend called 'Alpine divorce' is spreading online. It describes abandoning a partner in remote mountains during a hike. This dark concept, inspired by a 19th-century story, has resurfaced on social media. People are sharing stories of betrayal and survival in the wilderness. The trend highlights fears of isolation and abandonment in modern relationships.

title: Bombay HC directs MSRTC to pay Rs 50 lakh to widow of employee who died of Covid-19 while on duty
content: The Bombay High Court has ordered the Maharashtra State Road Transport Corporation (MSRTC) to pay Rs 50 lakh compensation to the widow of an employee who died of Covid-19. The court ruled that the deceased, Bapu Jagtap, contracted the virus while performing his duty at the risk of his life, rejecting MSRTC's claim that he was not assigned essential services.

title: 'Did Robert Vadra, Rahul go to jail?' Kejriwal hits back as Congress questions HC relief
content: In a strongly worded ruling, Special Judge (PC Act) Jitender Singh of the Rouse Avenue Court said the prosecution‚Äôs case was "legally infirm, unsustainable, and unfit to proceed any further in law". The court further observed that when the material collected by the agency was tested on admissibility, relevance and probative value, "the appearance of a coherent conspiracy dissolves," exposing the allegations as being founded on inadmissible material and post-facto reconstruction.

title: Uniforms, fake IDs, pistol: How maid plotted 'ED' raid in south Delhi
content: A domestic help orchestrated a fake Enforcement Directorate raid on her elderly employer's home in Delhi, enlisting relatives and associates. The plan unraveled when the victim's grandson, an ED lawyer, confronted the imposters by phone, leading to their escape with a portion of the stolen cash. The maid and her sister-in-law have been arrested.

title: Afghanistan claims it downed a Pakistani F-16. Can Kabul really shoot one down?
content: Afghanistan claimed Pakistan lost an F-16 fighter jet during overnight strikes, sharing unverified video footage. Pakistan has not confirmed the loss, and X's AI tool flagged the video as not authentic. The claim follows Pakistan's military action in retaliation for alleged Afghan firing.

title: Decoding 7.8% GDP growth: What it means for India's road to become 3rd largest economy
content: What does the GDP data tell you about the Indian economy? When will India become the third largest economy? What‚Äôs changed in the new GDP series and why is it important? We take a look:

title: Film director abducted, assaulted in Karnataka; actor Aishwarya among 11 arrested
content: A film director was abducted and assaulted in Bengaluru over a financial dispute concerning an under-production Kannada movie. Eleven individuals have been arrested in connection with the incident, which involved the director being robbed of gold ornaments and cash. The motive appears to stem from outstanding payments and a disagreement over film investments.

title: 'Shotgun wedding': Teenage lovers skip exam to marry at temple; cops thwart plan
content: A teenage couple in Varanasi, aiming to marry instead of taking their UP Board exams, were intercepted by police. Officers responsibly escorted the students to their respective exam centers first. Post-examination, the 17-year-old girl was taken to the child welfare committee, and both were later permitted to return home after age verification.

title: Yami Gautam praises Dhurandhar 2 after watching it
content: Following the massive success of 'Dhurandhar', actress Yami Gautam has revealed she has already seen the sequel and is stunned by its quality. She praised director and husband Aditya Dhar's passion and dedication, calling 'Dhurandhar 2' an unforgettable experience that will make every Indian proud.

title: Area 51: The truth about UFOs, Aliens in America‚Äôs most mysterious military site
content: Recent remarks by President Trump about releasing UFO files have reignited interest in Area 51, a secretive US military site in Nevada. Established in 1955 for classified aircraft testing, its existence was officially acknowledged in 2013. While the government attributes UFO sightings to advanced aircraft testing, public speculation about aliens persists.

title: Matt Holliday's Stillwater estate listed for $12 million
content: a Stillwater, Oklahoma, home that once belonged to an MLB champion and seven-time All-Star is on the market at $12 million . the home features sports-related amenities such as a professionally lit baseball field in the front yard, a putting green in the backyard, and a $2 million, two-level swimming pool . indoor batting cages, pickleball and basketball courts reside in a detached $150,000 guest home on the property .

title: Power Rankings: Stakes are high for UCLA, two teams rejoin the list
content: the Bruins will be just the fourth program to finish with a perfect regular season in the Big Ten women's college basketball . the last to do it was Maryland in 2015, the season the Terps joined the big Ten and advanced to the final Four for the second year in a row .

title: NHL Power Rankings: New 1-32 poll, over/under bet for each team
content: the 2026 Olympic ice hockey tournament is complete . all players have returned to their teams, some to the ice, others to injured reserve . a new 1-32 poll is based on the games through Wednesday . it's time to take the temperature with another set of Power Rankings .

title: Preview for the 2026 PLL, WLL Championship Series: Key players, schedule, predictions
content: the 2026 PLL and WLL Championship Series runs from Feb. 27 to March 8 . the event uses the Sixes format, which will be used when lacrosse returns to the Olympics in 2028 . it has key differences from outdoor "field" lacross and indoor "box" la crosse .

title: The game that will define the 2026 season for every power-conference team
content: the season-defining game will be for all 68 power-conference teams in 2026 . peruse BC's schedule given last year's struggles, and it's tough to find many wins . the Eagles open on the road at Cincinnati, then play FCS Maine .

title: How the top QB signings will fit in 2026
content: the top 2026 recruits at each position could fit at their new schools . the perfect harmony between skill and scheme can lead to production and wins on the field . this is the most high-profile prospect Houston has signed in the modern era .

title: An Ivy League All-American? The next Theo Epstein? Why an ace chose Yale over the SEC
content: OHman was a freshman navigating his first collegiate baseball season . the 6-foot right-hander barely pitched in high school . he admits he considered leaving the Ivy League for a power 4 school, but who would blame him .
